translator_notes: 「西厢记」(The Western Chamber/Romance of the Western Wing) is a famous Yuan Dynasty play by Wang Shifu, considered risqué for its romantic themes
「牡丹亭」(The Peony Pavilion) is a Ming Dynasty Kunqu opera by Tang Xianzu, famous for its exploration of love transcending death
「杨妃」refers to Yang Guifei, Tang Dynasty imperial consort famous for her beauty; 「飞燕」refers to Zhao Feiyan, Han Dynasty empress known for her slender figure
「金兰契」(Golden Orchid Bond) is a traditional term for sworn sisterhood or deep female friendship
「鸳鸯」(Mandarin ducks) symbolize faithful couples in Chinese culture - the maid Yuanyang's name means 'Mandarin Duck'
「呆霸王」(Foolish Tyrant) is a nickname for Xue Pan, referring to his violent and stupid behavior
research_notes: Chapters 27 and 38 feature some of the most famous poetry in the novel - the 'Flower Burial Song' (葬花吟) and the chrysanthemum/crab poems
The chapter titles often contain literary allusions and wordplay that foreshadow events
「林潇湘」and「薛蘅芜」are poetic names for Lin Daiyu and Xue Baochai, derived from their residences
